definition: to take a lot of trouble (idiom); painstaking/at the cost of a lot of effort
fiend/demon/very/(Tw) SARS (loanword)
to terminate/to cut short/to bring to a stop/to squeeze/to tighten/to damage/variant of 殺|杀[sha1]
to cost/to spend/fee/wasteful/expenses
surname Fei
bitter/hardship/pain/to suffer/to bring suffering to/painstakingly
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: She took great pains in educating her children.
sentences.chinese: 她煞费苦心教育她的子女。

sentences.english: Said is at pains to make a distinction, therefore, between truth and value.
sentences.chinese: 赛义德为区分真理和价值，这两个概念煞费苦心。

sentences.english: He took great pains to manage the factory well.
sentences.chinese: 为了管理好工厂，他可真是煞费苦心。

sentences.english: Companies are at pains to present themselves as warm-and-fuzzy global citizens.
sentences.chinese: 公司都煞费苦心地把自己打扮成讨人喜欢的世界公民。

sentences.english: They grabbed what they could get for the sake of what was to be got.
sentences.chinese: 为了能捞到想得到的东西，不惜煞费苦心，巧取豪夺。

to ponder earnestly/to give a lot of thought to sth
to rack one's brains for schemes (idiom)/to beat one's brains out
to spare no effort/to devote all one's energies
hard-earned capital
to rack one's brains
committing all manner of crimes/completely unscrupulous

definition: to plot actively (idiom)/scheming/calculating
to make painstaking efforts (idiom); after much trouble/to work hard at sth
to dig for thoughts (idiom); to search everything for an answer/to rack one's brains
to take great pains/to go to a lot of trouble
brains
painstaking effort/to take a lot of trouble/laborious at pains
not stint/not spare/not hesitate (to do sth)/not scruple (to do sth)
to exhaust one's thoughts and ingenuity (idiom); to think sth through thoroughly/to rack one's brains/to leave no stone unturned
to suffer untold hardships (idiom); trials and tribulations/with difficulty/after some effort
